channel.title: Bits, Bytes, Late Nights
channel.description: Recent content on Bits, Bytes, Late Nights

item.title: Minecraft and the Simulation Hypothesis
item.description: Are we reaching the hardware limitations of our simulated universe?

item.title: Contact Tracing Privacy
item.description: An analysis of Apple’s novel contact tracing protocol for COVID-19 though the lens of a paranoid privacy enthusiast.

item.title: Why (Not) Peer-to-Peer?
item.description: An overview of the Internet’s growth in the 2010s and some questions about what’s to come… With the current state of centralized content distribution, why aren’t we moving to a peer-to-peer model?

item.title: Notes
item.description: Welcome to my comprehensive note directory. These typeset works of art are the product of untold hours of study and synthesis of various graduate-level topics in computer science. They were created specifically for Georgia Tech’s graduate program, but most of them should be self-contained and well-structured enough to serve as a gentle introduction to many different topics: My notes on Computational Perception are the ones that started it all.

item.title: My Pescetarian Recipe Collection
item.description: A collection of tasty pescetarian recipes that I’ve gathered over the years with my personal tweaks and suggestions included.

item.title: Optimizing Sessionless Sessions
item.description: Or, arriving at the rationale behind the existence of JSON Web Tokens.

item.title: Efficient P2P Broadcasting
item.description: A memory-less solution that minimizes extra message duplication.

item.title: Tracking Your Every Move
item.description: Or, abusing MAC addresses for fun and profit (well, no profit unless you’re a massive corporation or the government…).

item.title: Hello there,
item.description: I’m George. I study computer science and sometimes cook things. I’m a bit of a cypherpunk at heart, particularly interested in cryptography, peer-to-peer technologies, and applications of virtual and augmented reality. Fittingly, I work at Stellar, creating (hopefully) useful abstractions to the underlying protocol for developers to create apps on our blockchain. I write about these topics and others in various (albeit rare) posts. I also enjoy full sending down Lombard Street on my longboard and finding new Bay Area views on hikes.

item.title: Privacy <3
item.description: Woah, how’d you get here? This page isn’t even linked from anywhere ðŸ˜œ This site has no tracking, no ads, and no nonsense. I have no idea who reads it, so if you like (or hate!) a post, shoot me an email and tell me! JavaScript is only used to render math with $\LaTeX$ (I might change this at some point to pre-render images, instead). I believe this is the way the Web should always be.
